Detailed Description

Surface shader.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Enumerator:
MAX_LIGHTS  Maximum number of lights supported by any shader.

enum Shader::Flags

Compilation flags for the material.

Enumerator:
SHADER_DEFAULT  Default material.

SHADER_LIGHTMAPPING  Shader should enable lightmapping if supported.

SHADER_TWOSIDED  Two sided material.

SHADER_MASK  Shader flags bits.

enum Shader::ParamType

Dynamic shader parameter types.

Dynamic shader parameters must be set after NS(Shader,begin)() call. Static parameters (=parameters specified by strings) can be set anytime.

Enumerator:
PARAM_NONE  Invalid parameter.
PARAM_CAMERAP  World space position of camera.
PARAM_WORLDTM  Local->world transform.
PARAM_VIEWTM  World->camera transform.
PARAM_VIEWTMINV  Camera->world transform.
PARAM_VIEWPROJTM  World->camera->projection transform.
PARAM_PROJTM  View->projection transform.
PARAM_TOTALTM  Local->screen transform.
PARAM_BONEWORLDTM  Local->world transform array for bones.
PARAM_LIGHTP0  World position of light 0.
PARAM_LIGHTP1  World position of light 1.
PARAM_LIGHTP2  World position of light 2.
PARAM_LIGHTP3  World position of light 3.
PARAM_LIGHTP4  World position of light 4.
PARAM_LIGHTP5  World position of light 5.
PARAM_LIGHTP6  World position of light 6.
PARAM_LIGHTP7  World position of light 7.
PARAM_LIGHTC0  Color of light 0.
PARAM_LIGHTC1  Color of light 1.
PARAM_LIGHTC2  Color of light 2.
PARAM_LIGHTC3  Color of light 3.
PARAM_LIGHTC4  Color of light 4.
PARAM_LIGHTC5  Color of light 5.
PARAM_LIGHTC6  Color of light 6.
PARAM_LIGHTC7  Color of light 7.
PARAM_COUNT  Number of different dynamic parameters.

enum Shader::SortType

Sorting mode which should be used with this shader.

Enumerator:
SORT_NONE  No sort needed.

SORT_BACKTOFRONT  Polygons of this material should be drawn back-to-front order.

SORT_FRONTTOBACK  Polygons of this material should be drawn front-to-back order.

SORT_INSIDEOUT  Polygons of this material should be drawn inside-out order.

SORT_OUTSIDEIN  Polygons of this material should be drawn outside-in order.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int Shader::begin (  )  [pure virtual]

Begins rendering geometry using the shader.

Prefer not using this method directly, but use Begin helper class instead. Rendering sequence:

  1. First call NS(Shader,begin)() for the shader before rendering any geometry
  2. Set shader parameters which need to be updated every frame, like transforms.
  3. Call NS(Shader,beginPass)(0) to start rendering geometry using the first pass of the shader.
  4. Call render() for each primitive to be rendered.
  5. Call NS(Shader,endPass)() to stop rendering using this pass of the shader.
  6. Loop to NS(Shader,beginPass)(i) for other passes, as many times as return value of begin() specified.
  7. End rendering by calling NS(Shader,end)() for the shader.
    Returns:
    Number of passes to be rendered. 0 if shader is disabled.

virtual void Shader::beginPass ( int  pass  )  [pure virtual]

Begins rendering using specified pass.

See begin() for description of the rendering sequence.

virtual Shader* Shader::clone (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns clone of this shader.

All parameters are unique to each clone, but code and other constants are shared.

virtual bool Shader::enabled (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns true if the shader is enabled.

See also:
setTechnique

virtual void Shader::end (  )  [pure virtual]

Ends rendering using this shader.

See begin() for description of the rendering sequence.

virtual void Shader::endPass (  )  [pure virtual]

Ends rendering using specified pass.

See begin() for description of the rendering sequence.

virtual int Shader::priority (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns priority of the shader.

Higher priority shaders need to be rendered before lower priority ones. Default priority is 0. Priorities can be negative. Every even priority shader objects are drawn from front to back and odd priority shader objects from back to front.

virtual void Shader::setTechnique ( const char *  name  )  [pure virtual]

Sets rendering technique to be used when rendering objects using this shader.

If the requested technique is not supported, the shader is disabled until valid technique is set.

Parameters:
name Name of the rendering technique to be set. Pass 0 or empty string to restore default technique.
See also:
enabled
Exceptions:
GraphicsException If technique is found but corrupted.

virtual SortType Shader::sort (  )  const [pure virtual]

Returns preferred sort mode of the shader.

Default sort mode is SORT_NONE.

static ParamType Shader::toParamType ( const char *  sz  )  [static]

Converts string to shader parameter type.

Returns:
PARAM_NONE if string not valid parameter name.
